thread.title: Chuck Barris: host of the Gong Show dies at 87

title: Chuck Barris: host of the Gong Show dies at 87
text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Chuck Barris: host of the Gong Show dies at 87 Chuck Barris, whose game show empire included The Dating Game, The Newlywed Game and that infamous factory of cheese, The Gong Show, has died at 87. Post to Facebook Chuck Barris: host of the Gong Show dies at 87 Chuck Barris, whose game show empire included The Dating Game, The Newlywed Game and that infamous factory of cheese, The Gong Show, has died at 87. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2nBqNqd Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Chuck Barris: host of the Gong Show dies at 87 None Chuck Barris, whose game show empire included The Dating Game, The Newlywed Game and that infamous factory of cheese, The Gong Show, has died at 87. Ron Tom, NBC, NBC via Getty Images None TV Producer Chuck Barris and his wife Mary at the Hollywood Radio and Television Society Newsmaker "Reality Television 2004" Luncheon in Los Angeles, Cali. Dec. 8, 2004 Stephen Shugerman, Getty Images None Game show producer Chuck Barris at a book signing for his "The Big Question" at in Los Angeles, Calif. May. 14, 2007. Amanda Edwards, Getty Images None Chuck Barris, host of the television's "Gong Show," and Robin Altman leave the Pierre Hotel in New York, Nov. 28, 1980. AP Chuck Barris on the Gong Show. NBC via Getty Images Chuck Barris on the Gong Show. NBC via Getty Images None Chuck Barris holds up his newest book, "Bad Grass Never Dies," at a Barnes and Noble in New York City June 30, 2004. Ian Wingfield, Getty Images None Writer Chuck Barris signs copies of his new book, "Bad Grass Never Dies," during a book signing in New York City, June 30, 2004. Getty Images None Chuck Barris Signs Copies of "Bad Grass Never Dies" at Book Soup on June 16, 2004 in West Hollywood, Calif. Giulio Marcocchi, Getty Images None Composer Milton Delugg and comedian Rip Taylor surprise game show producer Chuck Barris while he discusses his book "The Big Question" in Los Angeles, Calif.
